Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பகையகத்துச் சாவார் எளியர் அரியர் அவையகத்து அஞ்சா தவர்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Many indeed may (fearlessly) die in the presence of (their) foes; (but) few are those who are fearless in the assembly (of the learned).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition. On the left, a vast battlefield ('பகையகத்து') is shown, filled with countless warriors who are bravely facing death. This is presented as common ('எளியர்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, a grand assembly of the wise is shown. In the center of this assembly is a lone speaker, standing firm and speaking fearlessly ('அவையகத்து அஞ்சாதவர்'). This person is depicted as being surrounded by a rare, brilliant light, signifying that their courage is extremely rare ('அரியர்').
Layered_Composition.Background: The image contrasts the commonness of physical courage with the rarity of intellectual courage.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Many men have the courage to die in battle. Far rarer is the man who has the courage to speak without fear in a learned assembly.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The sheer number of brave soldiers on the left contrasts with the lone, rare speaker on the right. The speaker's brilliant, rare light shows their special value.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Contrasting two types of courage; valuing intellectual bravery over physical bravery.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The battlefield is lit with the harsh, chaotic light of war. The assembly is lit with a calm, intelligent light, but the speaker themself is the source of a uniquely brilliant aura.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A balanced, wide diptych that allows the viewer to compare the scale and nature of the two scenes.

Cultural_Anchors: Many die in battle ('பகையகத்துச் சாவார் எளியர்')
Few are fearless in assembly ('அவையகத்து அஞ்சாதவர் அரியர்')
Intellectual courage as a higher virtue.

Negative_Prompt: cowardly soldiers, a scared speaker, text artifacts.
